body_content.explanation: having a surface that is extremely smooth or slippery (= likely to cause something to slide from being very smooth or wet):
examples: The roads were super-slick after the ice storm.
The cabinets had a superslick black lacquer finish.

body_content.explanation: made or done in an extremely skilful way :
examples: The actor's latest film is a superslick crime caper set in 1940s Los Angeles.
The ice hockey player made a superslick move to evade the defender and shot the puck into the net.

body_content.explanation: extremely skilful and effective but not sincere or honest:
examples: We bought our used car from a superslick salesman who talked us into getting a model we really didn't want.
He plays the part of a super-slick trickster whose scams would only ever work in the movies.
